name: Entanglement of Photons
short_description: Jay Olson and Timothy Ralph recently put forward a theory that entangled photons can travel through time or at least take a short-cut through time using their method. As I understand it, the first photon is destroyed when measured however an exact copy is created in the future using qubits from the original photon. This is a simulation using one of their examples. I hope it's accurate and my apologies if it's not. Email: tmckeown@nbtv.ca
